page.title: 06BEDGEBURY SCHOOL
page.content: The Church Education Corporation, the School's governing body, was established in 1900 to promote independent education for girls in a Christian setting and has owned Bedgebury since 1920. There are about 400 pupils, mostly boarding but some day girls, of whom half (ages 14 to 18) are in the Upper School at Bedgebury Park and half (8 to 13) in Lower School at Lillesden in Hawkhurst, about 10 kilometres away. Up to the Fifth Year there is a core curriculum of English, maths, history, French and biology, with religious and physical education and options in the humanities, sciences and domestic and aesthetic subjects. 6th Form studies include advanced and vocational work. There are also sports, cultural and charitable activities, many in compet- ition/cooperation with other schools.
